articles.title: Letter of Protest Addressed to GNP Released
Halt to Joint Military Exercises Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Letter of Protest Addressed to GNP Released 
    Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia on March 20 released a letter addressed to the Grand National Party of south Korea in protest against the passage of the "motion on impeachment against the president" through the "National Assembly."
 The letter accused the GNP of having recently railroaded all sorts of evil bills and even the "motion on impeachment against the president" through the NA, taking advantage of its majority seats in it.    
 The Korean nationals in Russia are not repressing their bitter resentment at such anti-national acts of the GNP, the letter noted, demanding the party immediately revoke the "motion" and repent of its crimes committed against the nation and history as early as possible so that it may not perpetrate more crimes against the nation.

articles.content:
Greetings to Bangladeshi Prime Minister 
    Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Khaleda Zia, prime minister of Bangladesh, on the occasion of the day of its independence.
 The message sincerely wished the friendly Bangladeshi people prosperity and welfare, expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow stronger in conformity with their mutual interests.    
  Paek Nam Sun, foreign minister of the DPRK, also sent a similar message to M. Morshed Khan, foreign minister of Bangladesh.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Bangladesh
PRC Foreign Minister Leaves
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Bangladesh
    Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Iajuddin Ahmed, president of Bangladesh, today on the occasion of the day of independent.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to expend and develop.

articles.title: DPRK Government Economic Delegation Leaves for Nigeria
articles.content:
PRC Foreign Minister Leaves
    Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Li Zhaoxing, foreign minister of the People's Republic of China, and his party left here for home today.
 They were seen off in Pyongyang by Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and other officials concerned and Wu Donghe, PRC ambassador e. p. to the DPRK, and staff members of the Chinese embassy.

articles.title: Second Session of 11th SPA of DPRK Held

DPRK Government Economic Delegation Leaves for Nigeria
    Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- A DPRK government economic delegation led by Ri Ryong Nam, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, left here today to participate in the second meeting of the DPRK-Nigeria Joint Committee.
 It was seen off at the airport by an official concerned.
